poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Serving writs by day and Led Zep riffs by night
A body bridges awkward rifts in mental towns,
Wrists in stitches hid by sober watches
Till something rips. Blue rinse
In ricks of bouffant hair,
Jagged rinks of costume jewellery,
Frosty bard, the risks he never took.
